alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:25PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. .The combination of snow melt runoff and forecast rainfall will continue to increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to impact water plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Monday afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 17.8 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.5 feet on 04/14/1969. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
